remarks: Signum function.  Pronounced "signum" , otherwise it might be confused with "sine".  Defined as "sgn" in ISO 80000-2:2009(E) operation 2-9.13. It is named "sign" (with the same definition) in the "NIST Digital Library of Mathematical Functions" , front introduction, "Common Notations and Definitions" section at ~ http://dlmf.nist.gov/front/introduction#Sx4 . We define this over ` RR* ` ( ~ df-xr ) instead of ` RR ` so that it can accept ` +oo ` and ` -oo ` .  Note that ~ df-psgn defines the sign of a permutation, which is different.  Value shown in ~ sgnval .  (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 15-May-2015.)
statement: df-sgn $p |- sgn = ( x e. RR* |-> if ( x = 0 , 0 , if ( x < 0 , -u 1 , 1 ) ) ) $.
